Hi,

Is anyone else having this issue? i just updated to 0.9 but right at the start it seems all the buildings are already at level 3 and i can't upgrade them, however when i go to launch a rocket it tells me it is to heavy to launch, as if the launchpad wasn't upgraded

Edited December 21, 2014 by Claw
It's a weird bug on the 64bit version. You have to use the 32bit version ("KSP.exe") for now.
oh thanks, in that case ... TO SPACE!

Did you use the same save file you were using in 64bit?
I don't think buildings were upgradeable since 0.9.

Version .9 didn't have upgradable buildings. You probably got some kind of hacked version, I'd suggest buying the real thing from Squad or Steam.

Simupost

im talking about todays 0.9 beta, from steam, and i figured out the launcher was messing up and starting x64 even though i had it selected not to. its fine now that it launched 32bit version normally,

They're taking the mickey, because the beta version is 0.90 -- it's not a decimal; you can't shorten it to 0.9, since 0.9 was one of the versions of KSP before they ever required you to purchase it.

Anyway, this is a known glitch with the x64 version. I'll move this to the support sections.

the problem is only in the 64 Bit version

I got the game on steam

have uninstalled and reinstalled - and still on the 32Bit is ok and on the 64Bit all the buildings are fully upgrated

ok i have just checked and its the same on the 32bit version

As I said you have to run KSP.exe, not the launcher. You can still set all your preferred options in the launcher, but then close it and start KSP.exe.

Apparently that's how you start the 32-bit version if you have 64-bit Windows, although ridiculous.

Here's a quick fix to solve this issue:

In your save folder is a file in called persistent.sfs

Open this up in a text editor and search for ScenarioUpgradeableFacilities

Set all buildings (other than the flag) to lvl = 1

That will max the buildings regardless of what the game was showing before

Saves are located in Kerbal Space Program > Saves > (Save Name)
